name: Super Anti-Aging Serum
about: What it is:A powerful serum with active antioxidants that nurture the skin while visibly reducing the appearance of fine lines and wrinkles..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Fine Lines and Wrinkles, Dryness, and Dullness and Uneven Texture.Formulation:Lightweight Serum.Highlighted Ingredients:.Ingredient Callouts:This product is vegan, cruelty-free, and gluten-free..What Else You Need to Know:This serum contains extracts of purslane and skullcap that support the skin's rejuvenating qualities. It also replaces the skin’s moisture reservoirs using a formulation of both long- and short-chain hyaluronic acid, resulting in a visibly firmer, more youthful, and clearer complexion.
ingredients: -Purslane: A strong antioxidant that stimulates the body and supports skin health and rejuvenation..-Skullcap: An antioxidative herb compound that strengthens the skin barrier function to protect against free radicals...-Hyaluronic Acid: Long and short chain hyaluronic molecules provide both immediate and long-term hydration..... Water, Butylene Glycol, Lactobacillus/Portulaca Oleracea Ferment Extract, Propanediol, Phenoxyethanol, Sodium Hyaluronate, Ethylhexylglycerin, Leuconostoc/Radish Root Ferment Filtrate, Baicalin, Glutathione.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:..-Immediately after cleansing, place a dropper length of serum in the palm of your hand and gently pat onto the face, eye area, and neck...-Allow to absorb for 30 seconds before applying a Dr. Barbara Sturm Face Cream moisturizer (sold separately) in your preferred formulation.

reviews.review_text: Honestly, I don’t see how to justify this price point. 200$ for a 10 mL bottle of a supposed «super anti-aging» product without really any anti-aging ingredients in it doesn’t make it for me. Also, it’s important to understand that there’s no magical ingredient already discovered that have the power of reverse aging permanently so don’t be fooled. With that being said, the serum is really hydrating, feels great on the skin and is absorbed really quickly. If that’s worth 200$ for you, go for it!

reviews.review_text: I have used this entire bottle day and night and I am disappointed. I saw no change the same day I used it or when I finished the bottle. The pricing should be $20 not $200.

reviews.review_title: FINALLY! A one all to END ALL!
reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, red hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: Gifted by Dr. Barbara Sturm | I have used a plethora of facial serums in my lifetime. It becomes tiring after countless products trial and errors. My skin is easily irritated and sensitive which makes it far more difficult when sampling and trying new products. The redness one product would produce, another would have to counter, followed by another product that causes dryness which required ANOTHER to replenish moisture. THIS SERUM ACHIEVES ALL THE BENEFITS IN JUST ONE!!! My skin has changed as I entered my 30s and this serum has been such a great addition to my skincare needs. I’ve noticed that not only does my irritation areas calm and redness subside, but also packs a punch of moisture which address the little lines near my eyes and especially my neck! My neck was a problem area of mine as my face skin looked ok but my neck looked not so great. I’ve been using this for about 2 weeks now from the time it arrived and I am hooked! I’m usually not one for expensive skincare but honestly the investment is absolutely worth it! My face and neck feel and look so good I can already see some improvement in moisture and retention. The serum is easily absorbed by my skin and doesn’t leave a greasy or shiny residue. I can apply my moisturizer soon after and it does a great job of not causing a chemical reaction where the cream won’t absorb and/or makeup begins to peel because of the product build up. A little goes a LONG way and you don’t need very much as it is RICH and easily distributed. Just one dropper full will cover your entire face and neck. Even then I find myself having to use less than that. Honestly, it’s taken care of the dehydrated eye skin area. It’s a great serum to have in your skincare arsenal. I’ve used with other Dr. Barbara Sturm products and it really does compliment them. Definitely a great new brand to replace multiple steps in my already lengthy routine. Im happy with this serum! 9/10! (1 point off due to price, but so worth it!) Before & After below

Bye bye forehead wrinkles!  After just a week of using the serum, I noticed a difference; and after two weeks, the wrinkles are almost completely gone. I can't believe the difference.   I integrated the serum into my night-time skin routine & it layered nicely with all my other products. The packaging feels very expensive. This was gifted by drbarbarastrum but will definitely repurchase.  This is a great serum, I am completely shocked and addicted. Check out my photo to see the improvement

I've been using this product for a few weeks now, and I can already see a noticeable difference in the texture of my skin. It feels smoother and more plump, which makes me look and feel more youthful. Finally, the anti-aging powerhouses Purslane and Skullcap are key active, high concentration ingredients that really make this product stand out. I can feel the difference in the quality of the ingredients, and I'm confident that I'm giving my skin the best possible care. Overall, I would highly recommend the Potent Hydration and Anti-Aging Cocktail to anyone who is looking for a high-quality skincare product that really delivers results. It's packed with nourishing ingredients, it's incredibly hydrating, and it really does reduce the visible signs of aging. reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This is a hard review to write. As a skincare enthusiast, I looked at the ingredients in this product and assumed that I wouldn’t be very impressed with the results. However, I heard all the hype and was fortunate enough to receive this complimentary from Dr. Barbara Sturm, so I gave it a whirl.  It didn’t take long for me to understand the hype. My skin started looking more even, more radiant, more healthy quite rapidly.  There’s a few possibilities to explain what happened here. One, the product itself might be formulated with higher grade ingredients. This applies especially with any plant-based ingredients. When we see “extracts” on the label, it’s impossible to know much about the quality of the extract itself. Perhaps Dr. Sturm is using higher quality ingredients.  Secondly, I think a simplistic formula might actually be…well, best. The fewer variables there are in a product, the lower the risk for the opposite effect from a product (ie: irritation, allergy, etc). While this has a short ingredients list, I actually do think that is a better approach.  Ultimately, I do feel conflicted after trying this!! I had great results, but the price point is still very high. I have inner conflict over the inaccessibility issue of skincare. Thus I will ultimately make my ranking on results and exclude the price point which…shockingly, means, I have to give this a 5 star review.

I have combination skin and my t-zone can get extremely oily in the hot and humid environment I’m in, so I’m always on the lookout for a serum I can wear by itself (without a cream) during the day. I prefer it, as serums usually don’t make my skin oilier, but they have to be hydrating enough on their own. This serum does a great job at that. I spray my face with water, then apply a few drops of this product and tap it in.   It feels hydrating, luxurious and light on my skin. It’s not sticky and the scent is pleasant. I’m very pleased with it so far and never used a product with Gluthatione, Skullcap or Purslane extract. I can’t wait to see long term results. reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, brown hair, Light skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: This line is for the global elite. If you do not earn top 1% wages, move on.   Let me explain why. I see reviews in which people state they only use the serum around areas with fine lines, or they only use a few drops, so “a little goes a long way.” The problem, and this is completely evidence based, is that Sturm has chosen dropped packaging. Which means that the product must be used within 90 days, or it will oxidize and lose potency. Please research the process of oxidation in skincare. All skincare should be in air tight containers to prevent oxidation. The best brands are. I’ve personally reached out to brands I wanted to love and challenged them on their packaging. One very popular brand blatantly lied to me and insisted that their products did not oxidize, which is just not true or possible. All chemical compounds (i.e everything) exposed to light and air will be altered and lose potency.   Save your money unless you can afford to go through the entire bottle in 90 days. Go see a dermatologist and get a five dollar tretinoin prescription and use a nice moisturizer over it.   I gave the product three stars. It’s a nice product. Her products are generally nice. I personally love her toner and use it every day.   To the person who complained about Phenoxyethanol: it’s in almost every product on the market. It’s a germicidal preservative. If it wasn’t in products they would be even more prohibitively expensive because they wouldn’t be shelf stable and thus companies could not scale product and keep back stock. It’s a well researched ingredient and it’s safe.

I’ve been using Dr. Sturm products for years, even had them shipped from her office in Germany, so I’m well versed in her line.  Ironically the best product for my skin are the glow drops...makes my skin wrinkle free, radiant and clear...everything I thought this would do...for half the price.  I’m not giving up on this though as my skin looks great in the morning except for the little breakouts... I’ll keep using it than use her spot concealer (yeah I know!) during the day.  Benefits outweigh the cons, but I think I’ll forego this in the future and use glow drops as an all around product.  Love her products though...bummed about the breakouts.

reviews.review_buyer_description: lightMedium skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: After loving a few of Dr.Sturm’s products and using some for over a year, I decided to try this serum. Trusting the brand that pride themselves on science research and not using ingredients that damage the skin barrier. So foolishly I didn’t go over every ingredient before buying and using it for two weeks. First off the texture is nothing like her HA Serum, it’s much thicker and on the sticky side so I only used it at night. I started to breakout and couldn’t understand why. The only thing that had changed was adding this serum. I decided to go through the ingredients and was shocked that it contain Phenoxyethanol! If you do your research on that ingredient you might think twice before putting it on your face. I do have sensitive skin but the past 5 years since using “cleaner” products and no fragrance in them my skin has been clear. I stopped using this serum 10 days ago and my skin is back to normal. Another thing to note is that I was talking with my friend about this serum because she was the one who introduced me to the line. She said she used this serum for 3 months without a reaction but said it did nothing for fine lines. It gives a temporary plump while it is on but no long term results. If this Super Anti-aging serum works for you that’s great but try not using it for a week and see if the results are still there?!? I have no problem paying for a $350 quality serum that does what it claims BUT this serum was a huge disappointment!

reviews.review_text: I received a sample of this a couple years ago and I really liked it. It felt light on the skin, absorbed quickly, and wasn't sticky or break me out. I also noticed some fine lines around my eyes diminish. That said, I got the same results from some of my Korean serums (with very similar ingredients to this one) for a tenth of the price. If you are looking to splurge on luxury skincare this is worth it, but there are much less expensive options that have similar ingredients and offer similar results.

reviews.review_title: Price point is off for what it is.
reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, brown hair, mediumTan skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: For the price tag of $350 I was expecting a miracle in a bottle or at least something more potent than what is out there. NOPE! It’s just another glorified serum. Save your money and see a professional.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Blue eyes, blonde hair, Light skin tone, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I have been using this serum for about a year now, and it has transformed my skin. My smile lines/crows feet are less, and my skin feels so much more plump because of the hyaluronic acid. I use it morning and night. Sinks in beautifully before applying moisturizer. I have sensitive, acne prone skin and this has been great for it.  BEYOND excited Sephora is now selling this amazing line.
